intro: Globba racemosa var. hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's globba, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display. Globba racemosa var. hookeri prefers warm, humid environments and well-drained soil.
